sense.gloss: to collect, to gather, to save, to accumulate, to pile up
to amass, to accumulate, to store
waiting place for a wrestler beside the ring
tamari, variety of rich soy sauce (used for sashimi, etc.)
gathering spot, haunt, rendezvous, meeting place, hang-out
acid reflux, bile reflux, pyrosis, stomach acid (when it enters the esophagus), heartburn, indigestion, water brash
easily (beaten, destroyed, etc.), without difficulty, helplessly, without the least resistance

r_ele.r: ぶんかいじょうりゅうほう

sense.gloss: tank for holding excreta (often used for fertilizer) (fertiliser), night soil vat or reservoir
tank for holding human waste (used for fertilizer), night-soil reservoir, cesspool, cesspit
to save up, to stockpile, to stash away, to hoard, to amass, to salt away
sunny spot, exposure to the sun
garbage dump, scrap heap, rubbish dump, dump, dumpsite
unable to put up any resistance, unable to put up a fight, not standing a chance (against)
stuffing oneself with food, eating enough to go without food for some time
to feel relieved, to feel satisfied
to let the rent fall into arrears
waiting place for a wrestler beside the ring
tamari soy sauce, variety of rich soy sauce (used for sashimi, etc.)
to sigh, to breathe a sigh
accumulation, retention, collection, sequestration (as in carbon dioxide sequestration), storage (usually a liquid, e.g. rainwater, or behind a dam.)
tide pool, rocky place where sea water remains after the tide draws out
bucket (for carrying sake, soy sauce, etc.)
puddle of blood, pool of blood
lacquering technique that uses a coloured-lacquer undercoating and a transparent-lacquer topcoat
drain and pool for collecting sewage, etc.
to take photographs for later use, to shoot video for archiving
harbour, harbor, haven, anchorage, a moorage
for tears to gather in one's eyes, for tears to well up in one's eyes
catching up on one's sleep, storing up sleep, getting extra sleep while one has the chance

sdata.j: ↑雨↑↓あめ↓のあと、↑道路↑↓どうろ↓に↑水溜↑↓みずた↓まりができた。
sdata.e: After the rain, there were puddles on the street.

sdata.j: ↑雨↑↓あめ↓が↑岩場↑↓いわば↓の↑窪↑↓くぼ↓んだところにいくつもの↑水溜↑↓みずた↓まりを↑作↑↓つく↓っていた。
sdata.e: Rain formed pools in the hollow spaces on the rocks.

sdata.j: ↑人↑↓ひと↓は↑溜↑↓た↓まれば↑溜↑↓た↓まるほど↑欲↑↓ほ↓しくなるものだ。
sdata.e: The more you have, the more you want.

sdata.j: ↑新↑↓あたら↓しいパソコンを↑買↑↓か↓うつもりで↑金↑↓かね↓を↑溜↑↓た↓めているんだ。
sdata.e: I am saving money in order to buy a new personal computer.

sdata.j: ↑水↑↓みず↓の↑淀↑↓よど↓む↑所↑↓ところ↓には↑汚物↑↓おぶつ↓が↑溜↑↓たま↓る。
↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑海外↑↓かいがい↓↑旅行↑↓りょこう↓のため↑金↑↓きん↓を↑溜↑↓た↓めている。
sdata.e: He is saving money for a trip abroad.

sdata.j: ↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓は↑目↑↓め↓に↑涙↑↓なみだ↓を↑溜↑↓た↓めていた。
sdata.e: Her eyes were filled with tears.

sdata.j: ↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓は↑出来↑↓でき↓るだけお↑金↑↓かね↓を↑溜↑↓た↓めようと↑努力↑↓どりょく↓している。
sdata.e: She is trying to save as much money as she can.

sdata.j: ↑盛大↑↓せいだい↓な↑溜息↑↓ためいき↓をつきながら、テーブルの↑上↑↓じょう↓にどさどさとパンを↑置↑↓お↓き、↑椅子↑↓いす↓にどっかりと↑腰掛↑↓こしか↓ける。
sdata.e: Heaving a great sigh I plunk my bread on the table and flump onto the chair.

sdata.j: 「↑溜息↑↓ためいき↓なんてついてた？」「↑不幸↑↓ふしあわ↓せなオーラ↑出↑↓だ↓しながらね」
sdata.e: Did I really sigh? "While giving out an aura of unhappiness."

sdata.j: 「ああ！」と↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓は↑溜息↑↓ためいき↓をつきました。
どんなに↑焦↑↓あせ↓っても↑庶務↑↓しょむ↓↑的↑↓てき↓な↑仕事↑↓しごと↓がどんどん↑溜↑↓た↓まってきて↑追↑↓お↓いつかない。
sdata.e: No matter how much I rush it, miscellaneous work keeps piling up and I can't catch up with it.

sdata.j: ↑黒↑↓くろ↓い↑小↑↓しょう↓↑猫↑↓ねこ↓がぴょんぴょんと↑水溜↑↓みずため↓をさけて、↑隣↑↓となり↓の↑生垣↑↓いけがき↓の↑下↑↓した↓をくぐった。
sdata.e: The black kitten hopped to avoid the puddle, and passed under the neighbouring hedge.

sdata.j: ↑大丈夫↑↓だいじょうぶ↓？ ストレス↑溜↑↓た↓め↑込↑↓こ↓んでない？
sdata.e: Are you okay? Are you stressed?

sdata.j: ↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓は↑目↑↓め↓に↑涙↑↓なみだ↓を↑溜↑↓た↓めながら↑話↑↓はな↓した。
sdata.e: She spoke with tears in her eyes.

sdata.j: ↑今日↑↓きょう↓こそ、↑溜↑↓た↓まった↑家事↑↓かじ↓をやっつけるぞ。
sdata.e: Today is the day I finally bang out all the housework that's been needing to be done.

sdata.j: ↑肺↑↓はい↓に↑溜↑↓た↓まった↑煙↑↓けむり↓を↑吐↑↓は↓き↑出↑↓だ↓し、↑暗↑↓くら↓い↑公園↑↓こうえん↓に↑視線↑↓しせん↓を↑向↑↓む↓ける。
sdata.e: I clear my lungs of the smoke lingering inside, and turn my eyes to a park shrouded in the dark.

sdata.j: ↑疲↑↓つか↓れが↑溜↑↓た↓まると↑無性↑↓むしょう↓に↑体↑↓からだ↓に↑悪↑↓わる↓いもの↑食↑↓た↓べたくなるのなんでなんだろう。
sdata.e: I wonder why when we get tired, we want to eat a lot of junk food.
